title: "Maintain Your Combine: Essential Maintenance for John Deere S Series"

tasks.task: Performing combine harvester maintenance before, during, and after harvest season.
subtasks: Inspecting engine oil and coolant levels.
Checking belt and chain tension and wear.
Examining cutting platform, including knives and guards.
Inspecting threshing mechanism and cleaning shoe.
Cleaning out debris from previous season.
Testing lights and safety equipment.
Greasing all fittings as per manufacturer's recommendations.
Checking fluid levels daily (engine oil, hydraulic oil, coolant).
Inspecting belts and chains for tension and wear.
Cleaning radiator and cooling components.
Emptying rock trap.
Checking tire pressure.
Cleaning grain tank and unloading auger.
Cleaning crop residue from machine at day's end.
Checking for loose or missing bolts.
Inspecting header for damage or wear.
Checking for oil leaks and addressing them.
Thoroughly cleaning combine after harvest.
Removing crop residue to prevent rust and rodent damage.
Changing all fluids and filters.
Lubricating necessary points.
Touching up paint to prevent rust.
Storing combine in a dry, covered area if possible, or covering with a tarp.
Troubleshooting common issues such as uneven cutting, inconsistent threshing, grain loss, engine problems, and hydraulic issues.

tasks.task: Contacting a professional if unsure about maintenance tasks.
Sharing combine maintenance tips in comments.
Conducting pre-harvest inspecton and setup for combine harvester.
MAINTASK: Checking and preparing the combine's electrical system [though mentioned briefly, perhaps under lights and safety equipment].
Pre-Harvest Inspection and Setup
subtasks: Check engine oil level
Check coolant level
Inspect belts and chains
Examine cutting platform
Inspect threshing mechanism and cleaning shoe
Test lights and safety equipment

tasks.task: Daily Maintenance During Harvest
subtasks: Grease fittings as per manufacturer's recommendations
Check fluid levels (engine oil, hydraulic oil, coolant)
Inspect belts and chains
Clean radiator and cooling components
Empty rock trap if equipped
Check tire pressure and adjust if necessary
Clean grain tank and unloading auger
Clean residue from machine at end of day
Check bolts and nuts for looseness
Inspect header for damage or wear
Check for oil leaks and address them

tasks.task: Post-Harvest Care and Storage
subtasks: Thoroughly clean combine harvester
Remove all crop residue to prevent rust and rodent damage
Change all fluids and filters as per manufacturer's recommendations
Lubricate all necessary parts
Touch up paint to prevent rust
Store combine in a dry, covered area if possible
Use a tarp to protect combine from elements if stored outside

tasks.task: Troubleshooting Common Combine Problems
subtasks: Check sickle sections and guards for uneven cutting
Adjust concave clearance and rotor speed for inconsistent threshing
Inspect sieves and adjust fan speed for grain loss
Check fuel filters and lines for engine issues
Inspect hydraulic components for leaks and adjust fluid levels

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Contact professional for assistance with unclear maintenance tasks.

MAINTASK: Seek professional help for unclear maintenance steps. Or perhaps it's embedded in the tasks. For example, if someone is unsure about adjusting the concave, they may need to consult a professional. So maybe it's part of the troubleshooting task.

MAINTASK: Contact professional for maintenance assistance.
Performing combine harvester maintenance before, during, and after harvest season.
Troubleshooting common combine issues after harvest
Preparing and maintaining a combine harvester for optimal performance through regular inspection and care.

Conducting combine harvester maintenance involves thorough pre-harvest setup, daily operation checks, post-harvest care, and troubleshooting common issues. Each phase requires specific physical tasks such as checking fluid levels, inspecting belts, cleaning components, changing filters, and addressing machine issues.
Performing combine harvester maintenance involves multiple steps before, during, and after the harvest season. Key tasks include:
